column4: well guys... what do i need to reconfigure my system to new hardware? does ubuntu detects it by itself?
welll, it's giving me no video
how can i install the video driver from the shell?
how can i install the video driver from the shell?
i can't start the X server, can anybody help me?
what error do you get when you try to start it?
segmentation fault
was it working at one time? or is this a new install?
it was working, i just changed it to a different board, it started in low graphics mode, then it offered me the video driver, i installed, then reloaded and it's not working anymore
I tried it...ran terribly slow
are the menus and such in spanish or the software descriptions? It might be the repos you are using are supplying info in spanish
mmm interestng, let me check it
nope, sources are appointing to Main Server
what part of software center is in spanish? The menus at the top of the window? Or just the description and such?
yes, the descriptions, the menus are ok...  by now

the descriptions are not translated by the system. LANG would set the menus and such...that is why if you install the spanish language pack the menus in firefox change. The software descriptions are, if I remember correctly, downloaded from the repos
i think you are right, but i'm using the main server, not any latinamerican or spanish one
yes, but I think you are spinning your wheels looking at LANG and such. I think you should look at why you got the wrong info from the repos
right... maybe they're sending me info based on my time zone or counry?
sweden, right?
nope, colombian
then yes, might be country based....but check the link erSUL just sent
and erusul, thanks, software list was rebuilt and it is in the correct language now :)
